result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Mark Hendrickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalty - Theft >$5000-$10,000, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Edward F. Vlack February 29, 2016 - amend sentence to 1 year and 77 days.


***AMENDED***
Per Judge Edward F. Vlack February 17, 2016 - Defendant's release date from Minnesota is September 29, 2016 and Court orders release of confinement to be September 29, 2016 on St. Croix County matter.

-To run concurrent with Minnesota sentences.
-Court reads-in and dismisses Counts 2 through 10.
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
-Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
-Court notes 1 day credit under 973.155.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Concurrent with: to Minnesota sentences

-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Cooperate with any Evaluation, Assessment or Program as directed by Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Apology letter within 30 days.
-Restorative Justice Program if requested by Victims.
-Obtain GED or HSED.
-Random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Daniel Mark Hendrickson appeared from jail. Case called at 11:00 am. Atty Caton recites agreement. Defendant to plea to Count #1. Remaining counts to be read in and dismissed. No objection from ADA Correll. Court reviews Constitutional rights with Def. Court finds Def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for Count One, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def Guilty of count 1. Parties make sentencing arguements. Def makes statement. Court orders: 1 year 3 months i/c, 1 yr 3 months e/s

Preliminary hearing on August 26, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, with all persons listed in complaint and businesses and thier employees.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Comply with rules of Supervision

-Get current address to the Clerk of Court

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
